intro: Alsine aretioides, commonly known as the rock sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to rocky and arid environments. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and tiny, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous or coastal regions. Its succulent leaves help it retain moisture in dry conditions. Alsine aretioides is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in harsh environments.
